titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sylvester Winkler papers 1977.560
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:43:19 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection spans 1854 to 1870 and consists of a mortgage for Sylvester Winkler's bakery on Pacific Street in Brooklyn, and various business and tax receipts and licenses for Winkler's business. Sylvester Winkler operated a bakery at 752 Pacific Street at the corner of Vanderbilt Avenue in Brooklyn. His residence was above his place of business.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Sylvester Winkler papers, 1977.560, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Sylvester Winkler operated a bakery at 752 Pacific Street at the corner of Vanderbilt Avenue in Brooklyn. His residence was above his place of business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection spans 1854 to 1870 and consists of a mortgage for Sylvester Winkler's bakery on Pacific Street in Brooklyn, and various business and tax receipts and licenses for Winkler's business.
